Implementations SHOULD use one of the first two solutions where the general structure of the NNTP stream remains intact and SHOULD close the connection if it is no longer possible to parse it sensibly.
contents.zh-CHS: 在最后一种情况下，实现必须确保任何替换都不能用于绕过有效性或安全性检查。例如，非法序列%xC0.A0是空间（%x20）的超长编码。如果在命令行中被正确的编码替换，则需要在将命令行解析为单个参数之前执行此操作。如果替换是在解析之后进行的，则可以生成带有嵌入空格的参数，这是禁止的。“替换字符”的使用并没有这个问题，因为在非美国ASCII字符的任何地方都允许使用。在NNTP流的一般结构保持不变的情况下，实现应该使用前两个解决方案中的一个，如果不再能够合理地解析它，则应该关闭连接。

contents.text: 12.6. Caching of Capability Lists
contents.zh-CHS: 12.6. 缓存功能列表

contents.text: The CAPABILITIES command provides a capability list, which is information about the current capabilities of the server. Whenever there is a relevant change to the server state, the results of this command are required to change accordingly.
contents.zh-CHS: CAPABILITIES命令提供了一个功能列表，该列表是关于服务器当前功能的信息。每当服务器状态发生相关更改时，都需要相应地更改此命令的结果。

contents.text: In most situations, the capabilities list in a given server state will not change from session to session; for example, a given extension will be installed permanently on a server. Some clients may therefore wish to remember which extensions a server supports to avoid the delay of an additional command and response, particularly if they open multiple connections in the same session.
contents.zh-CHS: 在大多数情况下，给定服务器状态下的功能列表不会因会话而改变；例如，给定的扩展将永久安装在服务器上。因此，一些客户端可能希望记住服务器支持哪些扩展，以避免额外命令和响应的延迟，特别是当它们在同一会话中打开多个连接时。

contents.text: However, information about extensions related to security and privacy MUST NOT be cached, since this could allow a variety of attacks.
contents.zh-CHS: 但是，与安全和隐私相关的扩展信息不能缓存，因为这可能会允许各种攻击。

contents.text: For example, consider a server that permits the use of cleartext passwords on links that are encrypted but not otherwise:
contents.zh-CHS: 例如，考虑允许在加密但不是其他链接的链接上使用明文密码的服务器：

contents.text:
[Initial connection set-up completed.]
[S] 200 NNTP Service Ready, posting permitted
[C] CAPABILITIES
[S] 101 Capability list:
[S] VERSION 2
[S] READER
[S] NEWNEWS
[S] POST
[S] XENCRYPT
[S] LIST ACTIVE NEWSGROUPS
[S] .
[C] XENCRYPT
[Client and server negotiate encryption on the link]
[S] 283 Encrypted link established

[C] CAPABILITIES
[S] 101 Capability list:
[S] VERSION 2
[S] READER
[S] NEWNEWS
[S] POST
[S] XSECRET
[S] LIST ACTIVE NEWSGROUPS
[S] .
[C] XSECRET fred flintstone
[S] 290 Password for fred accepted
If the client caches the last capabilities list, then on the next session it will attempt to use XSECRET on an unencrypted link:
contents.zh-CHS: 如果客户端缓存最后一个功能列表，则在下一个会话中，它将尝试在未加密的链接上使用XSECRET：

contents.text:
[Initial connection set-up completed.]
[S] 200 NNTP Service Ready, posting permitted
[C] XSECRET fred flintstone
[S] 483 Only permitted on secure links
This exposes the password to any eavesdropper. While the primary cause of this is passing a secret without first checking the security of the link, caching of capability lists can increase the risk.
contents.zh-CHS: 这会将密码暴露给任何窃听者。虽然主要原因是在未首先检查链接安全性的情况下传递秘密，但缓存功能列表可能会增加风险。

contents.text: Any security extension should include requirements to check the security state of the link in a manner appropriate to that extension.
contents.zh-CHS: 任何安全扩展都应包括以适合该扩展的方式检查链路安全状态的要求。

contents.text: Caching should normally only be considered for anonymous clients that do not use any security or privacy extensions and for which the time required for an additional command and response is a noticeable issue.
contents.zh-CHS: 缓存通常只应考虑用于不使用任何安全或隐私扩展的匿名客户端，对于这些客户端，额外命令和响应所需的时间是一个值得注意的问题。

contents.text: Appendix A. Interaction with Other Specifications
contents.zh-CHS: 附录A.与其他规范的相互作用

contents.text: NNTP is most often used for transferring articles that conform to RFC 1036 [RFC1036] (such articles are called "Netnews articles" here). It is also sometimes used for transferring email messages that conform to RFC 2822 [RFC2822] (such articles are called "email articles" here). In this situation, articles must conform both to this specification and to that other one; this appendix describes some relevant issues.
contents.zh-CHS: NNTP最常用于传输符合RFC 1036[RFC1036]的文章（此类文章在这里称为“网络新闻文章”）。它有时也用于传输符合RFC 2822[RFC2822]的电子邮件（此类文章在此处称为“电子邮件文章”）。在这种情况下，物品必须同时符合本规范和另一规范；本附录描述了一些相关问题。

contents.text: A.1. Header Folding
contents.zh-CHS: A.1. 收割台折叠

contents.text: NNTP allows a header line to be folded (by inserting a CRLF pair) before any space or TAB character.
contents.zh-CHS: NNTP允许在任何空格或制表符之前折叠标题行（通过插入CRLF对）。

contents.text: Both email and Netnews articles are required to have at least one octet other than space or TAB on each header line. Thus, folding can only happen at one point in each sequence of consecutive spaces or TABs. Netnews articles are further required to have the header name, colon, and following space all on the first line; folding may only happen beyond that space. Finally, some non-conforming software will remove trailing spaces and TABs from a line. Therefore, it might be inadvisable to fold a header after a space or TAB.
contents.zh-CHS: 电子邮件和Netnews文章都必须至少有一个八位字节，而不是每个标题行上的空格或制表符。因此，折叠只能发生在每个连续空格或制表符序列中的一个点上。Netnews文章还要求标题名、冒号和后续空格都在第一行；折叠可能只发生在该空间之外。最后，一些不一致的软件将删除行中的尾随空格和制表符。因此，在空格或标签后折叠标题可能是不可取的。

contents.text: For maximum safety, header lines SHOULD conform to the following syntax rather than to that in Section 9.7.
contents.zh-CHS: 为了最大程度的安全，标题行应符合以下语法，而不是第9.7节中的语法。

contents.text:
header = header-name ":" SP [header-content] CRLF
header-content = [WS] token *( [CRLF] WS token )
A.2. Message-IDs
contents.zh-CHS: A.2. 消息ID

contents.text: Every article handled by an NNTP server MUST have a unique message-id. For the purposes of this specification, a message-id is an arbitrary opaque string that merely needs to meet certain syntactic requirements and is just a way to refer to the article.
contents.zh-CHS: NNTP服务器处理的每一篇文章都必须有一个唯一的message-id。就本规范而言，message id是一个任意的不透明字符串，它只需要满足某些语法要求，并且只是引用文章的一种方式。

contents.text: Because there is a significant risk that old articles will be reinjected into the global Usenet system, RFC 1036 [RFC1036] requires that message-ids are globally unique for all time.
contents.zh-CHS: 由于存在将旧文章重新注入全局Usenet系统的重大风险，RFC 1036[RFC1036]要求消息ID在任何时候都是全局唯一的。

contents.text: This specification states that message-ids are the same if and only if they consist of the same sequence of octets. Other specifications may define two different sequences as being equal because they are putting an interpretation on particular characters. RFC 2822 [RFC2822] has a concept of "quoted" and "escaped" characters. It therefore considers the three message-ids:
contents.zh-CHS: 本规范规定，当且仅当消息ID由相同的八位字节序列组成时，它们是相同的。其他规范可能将两个不同的序列定义为相等，因为它们对特定字符进行解释。RFC 2822[RFC2822]具有“引用”和“转义”字符的概念。因此，它考虑三个消息ID：

contents.text:
<ab.cd@example.com>
<"ab.cd"@example.com>
<"ab.\cd"@example.com>

as being identical. Therefore, an NNTP implementation handing email articles must ensure that only one of these three appears in the protocol and that the other two are converted to it as and when necessary, such as when a client checks the results of a NEWNEWS command against an internal database of message-ids. Note that RFC 1036 [RFC1036] never treats two different strings as being identical. Its successor (as of the time of writing) restricts the syntax of message-ids so that, whenever RFC 2822 would treat two strings as equivalent, only one of them is valid (in the above example, only the first string is valid).
contents.zh-CHS: 一模一样。因此，处理电子邮件文章的NNTP实现必须确保协议中仅出现这三个选项中的一个，并在必要时将其他两个转换为该选项，例如当客户端根据消息ID的内部数据库检查NEWNEWS命令的结果时。请注意，RFC1036[RFC1036]从不将两个不同的字符串视为相同。它的后继者（在编写本文时）限制消息ID的语法，以便无论何时RFC 2822将两个字符串视为等效字符串，其中只有一个是有效的（在上面的示例中，只有第一个字符串是有效的）。

contents.text: This specification does not describe how the message-id of an article is determined; it may be deduced from the contents of the article or derived from some external source. If the server is also conforming to another specification that contains a definition of message-id compatible with this one, the server SHOULD use those message-ids. A common approach, and one that SHOULD be used for email and Netnews articles, is to extract the message-id from the contents of a header with name "Message-ID". This may not be as simple as copying the entire header contents; it may be necessary to strip off comments and undo quoting, or to reduce "equivalent" message-ids to a canonical form.
contents.zh-CHS: 本规范不描述如何确定文章的消息id；它可能是从文章的内容推断出来的，也可能是从一些外部来源衍生出来的。如果服务器也符合另一个规范，其中包含与此规范兼容的消息id定义，则服务器应使用这些消息id。一种常见的方法，也应该用于电子邮件和Netnews文章，是从名为“message id”的标题内容中提取消息id。这可能不像复制整个标题内容那么简单；可能需要删除注释并撤消引用，或者将“等效”消息ID缩减为规范形式。

contents.text: If an article is obtained through the IHAVE command, there will be a message-id provided with the command. The server MAY either use it or determine one from the article contents. However, whichever it does, it SHOULD ensure that, if the IHAVE command is repeated with the same argument and article, it will be recognized as a duplicate.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果通过IHAVE命令获得文章，则该命令将提供消息id。服务器可以使用它，也可以根据文章内容确定一个。但是，无论它做了什么，它都应该确保，如果使用相同的参数和项目重复IHAVE命令，它将被识别为重复。

contents.text: If an article does not contain a message-id that the server can identify, it MUST synthesize one. This could, for example, be a simple sequence number or be based on the date and time when the article arrived. When email or Netnews articles are handled, a Message-ID header SHOULD be added to ensure global consistency and uniqueness.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果文章不包含服务器可以识别的消息id，则必须合成一个。例如，这可以是一个简单的序列号，也可以基于文章到达的日期和时间。处理电子邮件或Netnews文章时，应添加消息ID标头以确保全局一致性和唯一性。

contents.text: Note that, because the message-id might not have been derived from the Message-ID header in the article, the following example is legitimate (though unusual):
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，由于邮件id可能不是从本文中的邮件id标头派生的，因此以下示例是合法的（尽管不常见）：

contents.text:
[C] HEAD <45223423@example.com>
[S] 221 0 <45223423@example.com>
[S] Path: pathost!demo!whitehouse!not-for-mail
[S] Message-ID: <1234@example.net>
[S] From: "Demo User" <nobody@example.net>
[S] Newsgroups: misc.test
[S] Subject: I am just a test article
[S] Date: 6 Oct 1998 04:38:40 -0500
[S] Organization: An Example Net, Uncertain, Texas
[S] .
A.3. Article Posting
contents.zh-CHS: A.3. 文章投递

contents.text: As far as NNTP is concerned, the POST and IHAVE commands provide the same basic facilities in a slightly different way. However, they have rather different intentions.
contents.zh-CHS: 就NNTP而言，POST和IHAVE司令部以略微不同的方式提供相同的基本设施。然而，他们有着截然不同的意图。

contents.text: The IHAVE command is intended for transmitting conforming articles between a system of NNTP servers, with all articles perhaps also conforming to another specification (e.g., all articles are Netnews articles). It is expected that the client will already have done any necessary validation (or that it has in turn obtained the article from a third party that has done so); therefore, the contents SHOULD be left unchanged.
contents.zh-CHS: IHAVE命令用于在NNTP服务器系统之间传输一致性文章，所有文章可能也符合另一个规范（例如，所有文章都是Netnews文章）。预计客户已经进行了任何必要的验证（或者客户已经从第三方获得了物品）；因此，内容应保持不变。

contents.text: In contrast, the POST command is intended for use when an end-user is injecting a newly created article into a such a system. The article being transferred might not be a conforming email or Netnews article, and the server is expected to validate it and, if necessary, to convert it to the right form for onward distribution. This is often done by a separate piece of software on the server installation; if so, the NNTP server SHOULD pass the incoming article to that software unaltered, making no attempt to filter characters, to fold or limit lines, or to process the incoming text otherwise.
contents.zh-CHS: 相比之下，POST命令旨在当最终用户将新创建的项目注入这样的系统时使用。正在传输的文章可能不是符合要求的电子邮件或Netnews文章，服务器需要对其进行验证，并在必要时将其转换为正确的形式以便继续分发。这通常是通过在服务器上安装一个单独的软件来完成的；如果是这样，NNTP服务器应将传入的文章原封不动地传递给该软件，不尝试过滤字符、折叠或限制行，或以其他方式处理传入的文本。

contents.text: The POST command can fail in various ways, and clients should be prepared to re-send an article. When doing so, however, it is often important to ensure (as far as possible) that the same message-id is allocated to both attempts so that the server, or other servers, can recognize the two articles as duplicates. In the case of email or Netnews articles, therefore, the posted article SHOULD contain a header with the name "Message-ID", and the contents of this header SHOULD be identical on each attempt. The server SHOULD ensure that two POSTed articles with the same contents for this header are recognized as identical and that the same message-id is allocated, whether or not those contents are suitable for use as the message-id.
contents.zh-CHS: POST命令可能以各种方式失败，客户端应该准备重新发送文章。但是，在执行此操作时，通常必须确保（尽可能）为两次尝试分配相同的消息id，以便服务器或其他服务器能够将这两个项目识别为重复项。因此，对于电子邮件或Netnews文章，发布的文章应包含一个标题，标题名为“Message ID”，并且每次尝试时标题的内容应相同。服务器应确保具有此标题相同内容的两篇已发布文章被识别为相同，并分配相同的邮件id，无论这些内容是否适合用作邮件id。

Appendix C. Summary of Response Codes
contents.zh-CHS: 附录C.响应代码摘要

contents.text: This section contains a list of every response code defined in this document and indicates whether it is multi-line, which commands can generate it, what arguments it has, and what its meaning is.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节包含本文档中定义的每个响应代码的列表，并指出它是否为多行代码、哪些命令可以生成它、它有哪些参数以及它的含义。

contents.text: Response code 100 (multi-line) Generated by: HELP Meaning: help text follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码100（多行）由以下内容生成：帮助含义：帮助文本。

contents.text: Response code 101 (multi-line) Generated by: CAPABILITIES Meaning: capabilities list follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码101（多行）由：CAPABILITIES生成，含义如下：CAPABILITIES列表。

contents.text: Response code 111 Generated by: DATE 1 argument: yyyymmddhhmmss Meaning: server date and time.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码111由：DATE 1参数：yyyymmddhhmmss生成，意思是：服务器日期和时间。

contents.text: Response code 200 Generated by: initial connection, MODE READER Meaning: service available, posting allowed.
contents.zh-CHS: 允许连接，初始响应：200由服务生成。

contents.text: Response code 201 Generated by: initial connection, MODE READER Meaning: service available, posting prohibited.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码201由以下内容生成：初始连接，模式读取器含义：服务可用，禁止发布。

contents.text: Response code 205 Generated by: QUIT Meaning: connection closing (the server immediately closes the connection).
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码205由：QUIT生成，意思是：连接关闭（服务器立即关闭连接）。

contents.text: Response code 211 The 211 response code has two completely different forms, depending on which command generated it:
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码211 211响应代码有两种完全不同的形式，具体取决于生成它的命令：

contents.text: (not multi-line) Generated by: GROUP 4 arguments: number low high group Meaning: group selected.
contents.zh-CHS: （非多行）生成者：组4参数：数量低-高-组含义：选择组。

contents.text: (multi-line) Generated by: LISTGROUP 4 arguments: number low high group Meaning: article numbers follow.
contents.zh-CHS: （多行）生成者：LISTGROUP 4参数：number low high group含义：文章编号跟随。

contents.text: Response code 215 (multi-line) Generated by: LIST Meaning: information follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码215（多行）由以下内容生成：列表含义：信息如下。

contents.text: Response code 220 (multi-line) Generated by: ARTICLE 2 arguments: n message-id Meaning: article follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码220（多行）由以下内容生成：ARTICLE 2参数：n消息id含义：ARTICLE如下。

contents.text: Response code 221 (multi-line) Generated by: HEAD 2 arguments: n message-id Meaning: article headers follow.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码221（多行）由以下内容生成：HEAD 2参数：n消息id含义：后面是文章标题。

contents.text: Response code 222 (multi-line) Generated by: BODY 2 arguments: n message-id Meaning: article body follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 由多条主体代码生成的（多条主体代码：222）。

contents.text: Response code 223 Generated by: LAST, NEXT, STAT 2 arguments: n message-id Meaning: article exists and selected.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码223由：LAST、NEXT、STAT 2参数生成：n消息id含义：文章存在并已选定。

contents.text: Response code 224 (multi-line) Generated by: OVER Meaning: overview information follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码224（多行）由以下内容生成：过度含义：概述信息。

contents.text: Response code 225 (multi-line) Generated by: HDR Meaning: headers follow.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码225（多行）由：HDR生成，意思是：后面跟着标题。

contents.text: Response code 230 (multi-line) Generated by: NEWNEWS Meaning: list of new articles follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码230（多行）由以下人员生成：NEWNEWS含义：新文章列表。

contents.text: Response code 231 (multi-line) Generated by: NEWGROUPS Meaning: list of new newsgroups follows.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码231（多行）由：NEWGROUPS生成，意思是：新新闻组列表如下。

contents.text: Response code 235 Generated by: IHAVE (second stage) Meaning: article transferred OK.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码235由：IHAVE（第二阶段）生成，意思是：物品转移正常。

contents.text: Response code 240 Generated by: POST (second stage) Meaning: article received OK.
contents.zh-CHS: 回复代码240生成人：POST（第二阶段）意思是：物品已收到OK。

contents.text: Response code 335 Generated by: IHAVE (first stage) Meaning: send article to be transferred.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码335由：IHAVE（第一阶段）生成，意思是：发送要传输的文章。

contents.text: Response code 340 Generated by: POST (first stage) Meaning: send article to be posted.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码340由：POST（第一阶段）生成，意思是：发送要发布的文章。

contents.text: Response code 400 Generic response and generated by initial connection Meaning: service not available or no longer available (the server immediately closes the connection).
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码400由初始连接生成的通用响应，意思是：服务不可用或不再可用（服务器立即关闭连接）。

contents.text: Response code 401 Generic response 1 argument: capability-label Meaning: the server is in the wrong mode; the indicated capability should be used to change the mode.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码401通用响应1参数：能力标签含义：服务器处于错误模式；应使用指示的能力来改变模式。

contents.text: Response code 403 Generic response Meaning: internal fault or problem preventing action being taken.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码403一般响应含义：内部故障或问题阻止采取措施。

contents.text: Response code 411 Generated by: GROUP, LISTGROUP Meaning: no such newsgroup.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码411由：GROUP生成，LISTGROUP意思是：没有这样的新闻组。

contents.text: Response code 412 Generated by: ARTICLE, BODY, GROUP, HDR, HEAD, LAST, LISTGROUP, NEXT, OVER, STAT Meaning: no newsgroup selected.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码412由以下内容生成：文章、正文、组、HDR、标题、最后一个、列表组、下一个、结束、统计意味着：未选择新闻组。

contents.text: Response code 420 Generated by: ARTICLE, BODY, HDR, HEAD, LAST, NEXT, OVER, STAT Meaning: current article number is invalid.
contents.zh-CHS: 由以下内容生成的响应代码420：文章、正文、HDR、标题、最后一个、下一个、结束、统计意味着：当前文章编号无效。

contents.text: Response code 421 Generated by: NEXT Meaning: no next article in this group.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码421生成人：NEXT含义：此组中无下一篇文章。

contents.text: Response code 422 Generated by: LAST Meaning: no previous article in this group.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码422生成人：LAST Means:此组中没有以前的文章。

contents.text: Response code 423 Generated by: ARTICLE, BODY, HDR, HEAD, OVER, STAT Meaning: no article with that number or in that range.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码423由：ARTICLE、BODY、HDR、HEAD、OVER、STAT生成，意思是：没有包含该数字或该范围内的文章。

contents.text: Response code 430 Generated by: ARTICLE, BODY, HDR, HEAD, OVER, STAT Meaning: no article with that message-id.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码430由以下内容生成：ARTICLE、BODY、HDR、HEAD、OVER、STAT意味着：没有包含该消息id的文章。

contents.text: Response code 435 Generated by: IHAVE (first stage) Meaning: article not wanted.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码435由：IHAVE（第一阶段）生成，意思是：不需要物品。

contents.text: Response code 436 Generated by: IHAVE (either stage) Meaning: transfer not possible (first stage) or failed (second stage); try again later.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码436由以下内容生成：IHAVE（任一阶段）意思是：传输不可能（第一阶段）或失败（第二阶段）；请稍后再试。

contents.text: Response code 437 Generated by: IHAVE (second stage) Meaning: transfer rejected; do not retry.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码437生成：IHAVE（第二阶段）意思是：传输被拒绝；不要重试。

contents.text: Response code 440 Generated by: POST (first stage) Meaning: posting not permitted.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码440由：POST（第一阶段）生成，意思是：不允许发布。

contents.text: Response code 441 Generated by: POST (second stage) Meaning: posting failed.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码441由：POST（第二阶段）生成，意思是：POST失败。

contents.text: Response code 480 Generic response Meaning: command unavailable until the client has authenticated itself.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码480通用响应含义：在客户端对自身进行身份验证之前，命令不可用。

contents.text: Response code 483 Generic response Meaning: command unavailable until suitable privacy has been arranged.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码483通用响应含义：在安排适当的隐私之前，命令不可用。

contents.text: Response code 500 Generic response Meaning: unknown command.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码500通用响应含义：未知命令。

contents.text: Response code 501 Generic response Meaning: syntax error in command.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码501通用响应含义：命令中出现语法错误。

contents.text: Response code 502 Generic response and generated by initial connection
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码502通用响应，由初始连接生成

contents.text: Meaning for the initial connection and the MODE READER command: service permanently unavailable (the server immediately closes the connection).
contents.zh-CHS: 对于初始连接和模式读取器命令的含义：服务永久不可用（服务器立即关闭连接）。

contents.text: Meaning for all other commands: command not permitted (and there is no way for the client to change this).
contents.zh-CHS: 所有其他命令的含义：不允许使用命令（客户端无法更改此命令）。

contents.text: Response code 503 Generic response Meaning: feature not supported.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码503通用响应含义：不支持功能。

contents.text: Response code 504 Generic response Meaning: error in base64-encoding [RFC4648] of an argument.
contents.zh-CHS: 响应代码504通用响应含义：参数的base64编码[RFC4648]中存在错误。

contents.text: Appendix D. Changes from RFC 977
contents.zh-CHS: 附录D.RFC 977的变更

contents.text: In general every attempt has been made to ensure that the protocol specification in this document is compatible with the version specified in RFC 977 [RFC977] and the various facilities adopted from RFC 2980 [RFC2980]. However, there have been a number of changes, some compatible and some not.
contents.zh-CHS: 通常，已尽一切努力确保本文件中的协议规范与RFC 977[RFC977]中规定的版本以及RFC 2980[RFC2980]中采用的各种设施兼容。然而，有一些变化，有些兼容，有些不兼容。

contents.text: This appendix lists these changes. It is not guaranteed to be exhaustive or correct and MUST NOT be relied on.
contents.zh-CHS: 本附录列出了这些变化。不保证其详尽无遗或正确无误，且不得依赖。

contents.text: o A formal syntax specification (Section 9) has been added.
contents.zh-CHS: o 增加了正式语法规范（第9节）。

contents.text: o The default character set is changed from US-ASCII [ANSI1986] to UTF-8 [RFC3629] (note that US-ASCII is a subset of UTF-8). This matter is discussed further in Section 10.
contents.zh-CHS: o 默认字符集从US-ASCII[ANSI1986]更改为UTF-8[RFC3629]（请注意，US-ASCII是UTF-8的子集）。第10节将进一步讨论这一问题。

contents.text: o All articles are required to have a message-id, eliminating the "<0>" placeholder used in RFC 977 in some responses.
contents.zh-CHS: o 所有文章都需要有消息id，从而消除了RFC 977中在某些响应中使用的“<0>”占位符。

contents.text: o The newsgroup name matching capabilities already documented in RFC 977 ("wildmats", Section 4) are clarified and extended. The new facilities (e.g., the use of commas and exclamation marks) are allowed wherever wildmats appear in the protocol.
contents.zh-CHS: o RFC 977（“wildmats”，第4节）中已经记录的新闻组名称匹配功能得到了澄清和扩展。新设施（例如，使用逗号和感叹号）允许在协议中出现wildmats的任何地方使用。

contents.text: o Support for pipelining of commands (Section 3.5) is made mandatory.
contents.zh-CHS: o 命令管道化支持（第3.5节）是强制性的。

contents.text: o The principles behind response codes (Section 3.2) have been tidied up. In particular:
contents.zh-CHS: o 响应代码背后的原则（第3.2节）已经整理好。特别地：

contents.text: * the x8x response code family, formerly used for private extensions, is now reserved for authentication and privacy extensions;
contents.zh-CHS: * x8x响应代码系列以前用于私有扩展，现在保留用于身份验证和隐私扩展；

contents.text: * the x9x response code family, formerly intended for debugging facilities, are now reserved for private extensions;
contents.zh-CHS: * x9x响应代码系列以前用于调试设备，现在保留用于私有扩展；

contents.text: * the 502 and 503 generic response codes (Section 3.2.1) have been redefined;
contents.zh-CHS: * 502和503通用响应代码（第3.2.1节）已重新定义；

contents.text: * new 401, 403, 480, 483, and 504 generic response codes have been added.
o The rules for article numbering (Section 6) have been clarified (also see Section 6.1.1.2).
contents.zh-CHS: o 已澄清物品编号规则（第6节）（另见第6.1.1.2节）。

contents.text: o The SLAVE command (which was ill-defined) is removed from the protocol.
contents.zh-CHS: o 从协议中删除从属命令（定义错误）。

contents.text: o Four-digit years are permitted in the NEWNEWS (Section 7.4) and NEWGROUPS (Section 7.3) commands (two-digit years are still permitted). The optional distribution parameter to these commands has been removed.
contents.zh-CHS: o NEWNEWS（第7.4节）和NEWGROUPS（第7.3节）命令中允许使用四位数年（仍然允许使用两位数年）。已删除这些命令的可选分布参数。

contents.text: o The LIST command (Section 7.6.1) is greatly extended; the original is available as LIST ACTIVE, while new variants include ACTIVE.TIMES, DISTRIB.PATS, and NEWSGROUPS. A new "m" status flag is added to the LIST ACTIVE response.
contents.zh-CHS: o LIST命令（第7.6.1节）被大大扩展；原始版本以列表活动的形式提供，而新的变体包括ACTIVE.TIMES、DISTRIB.PATS和新闻组。新的“m”状态标志添加到列表活动响应中。

contents.text: o A new CAPABILITIES command (Section 5.2) allows clients to determine what facilities are supported by a server.
contents.zh-CHS: o 新的“能力”命令（第5.2节）允许客户端确定服务器支持哪些设施。

contents.text: o The DATE command (Section 7.1) is adopted from RFC 2980 effectively unchanged.
contents.zh-CHS: o 日期命令（第7.1节）从RFC 2980中采用，实际上没有改变。

contents.text: o The LISTGROUP command (Section 6.1.2) is adopted from RFC 2980. An optional range argument has been added, and the 211 initial response line now has the same format as the 211 response from the GROUP command.
contents.zh-CHS: o LISTGROUP命令（第6.1.2节）采用RFC 2980。添加了一个可选的范围参数，211初始响应行现在的格式与来自GROUP命令的211响应相同。

contents.text: o The MODE READER command (Section 5.3) is adopted from RFC 2980 and its meaning and effects clarified.
contents.zh-CHS: o 模式读取器命令（第5.3节）采用RFC 2980，并阐明其含义和效果。

contents.text: o The XHDR command in RFC 2980 has been formalised as the new HDR (Section 8.5) and LIST HEADERS (Section 8.6) commands.
contents.zh-CHS: o RFC2980中的XHDR命令已正式化为新的HDR（第8.5节）和列表头（第8.6节）命令。

contents.text: o The XOVER command in RFC 2980 has been formalised as the new OVER (Section 8.3) and LIST OVERVIEW.FMT (Section 8.4) commands. The former can be applied to a message-id as well as to a range.
contents.zh-CHS: o RFC 2980中的XOVER命令已正式化为新的OVER（第8.3节）和LIST OVERVIEW.FMT（第8.4节）命令。前者可以应用于消息id，也可以应用于范围。

contents.text: o The concept of article metadata (Section 8.1) has been formalised, allowing the Bytes and Lines pseudo-headers to be deprecated.
contents.zh-CHS: o 文章元数据的概念（第8.1节）已经正式化，允许不推荐使用字节和行伪头。

contents.text: Client authors should note in particular that lack of support for the CAPABILITIES command is a good indication that the server does not support this specification.
contents.zh-CHS: 客户机作者应特别注意，缺乏对CAPABILITIES命令的支持很好地表明服务器不支持此规范。
